metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5345 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Mapper component in Apache Tomcat 6.x before 6.0.45, 7.x before 7.0.68, 8.x before 8.0.30, and 9.x before 9.0.0.M2 processes redirects before considering security constraints and Filters, which allows remote attackers to determine the existence of a directory via a URL that lacks a trailing / (slash) character. It was discovered that the Tomcat mapper component incorrectly handled redirects. A remote attacker could use this issue to determine the existence of a directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5345` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1
No subscription required

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat7 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1').
tomcat8 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1').
